required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of CAR-T in the Treatment of Relapsed and Refractory Hematopoietic and Lymphoid Tissue Tumors in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial of CAR-T in the Treatment of Relapsed and Refractory Hematopoietic and Lymphoid Tissue Tumors in Children

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open, single-arm, prospective，clinical study to evaluate efficacy and safety of Auto CAR-T cell injection in the treatment of recurrent or refractory Hematopoietic and Lymphoid Tissue Tumors in Children

detailed_description.textblock: A single car consists of scFv, hinge region, transmembrane region, costimulatory domain and zeta subunit of CD3.Prior to CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be subjected to preconditioning treatment. After CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be evaluated for adverse reactions and efficacy.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: First month post CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the possible adverse events occurred within first one month after CAR-T infusion, including the incidence and severity of symptoms such as cytokine release syndrome and neurotoxicity
Remission Rate including complete remission(CR)、partial response(PR)、No remission(NR)、progressive disease(PD)

arm_group.description: Patients will be treated with Auto CAR-T cells

facility.name: Pediatric hematology, Hebei Medical University Fourth Hospital
